meanings.definition: A charge or fee for using a particular road or bridge.
meanings.sent1: The tolls for the bridge were too high for many drivers.
meanings.sent2: I had to pay the tolls to cross the highway.
meanings.sent3: The tolls for the new road were so expensive that I had to take a longer route.
meanings.sent4: The tolls on this highway are like a small tax on every journey.
meanings.sent5: The tolls at the entrance gate were a barrier to my travel plans.

meanings.definition: The sound of a bell ringing.
meanings.sent1: The tolls of the church bell echoed through the village.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the tolls of the alarm clock.
meanings.sent3: The tolls of the bell signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The tolls of the bell were a soothing melody in the evening.
meanings.sent5: The tolls of the bell added a peaceful atmosphere to the town square.

meanings.definition: To ring a bell slowly and repeatedly.
meanings.sent1: I tolls the bell to announce the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The church bells tolls every hour.
meanings.sent3: He tolls the bell to gather everyone for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The old clock tower tolls beautifully in the evening.
meanings.sent5: The bell tolls softly, creating a calming effect in the room.

meanings.definition: To cause harm or suffering over a period of time.
meanings.sent1: The constant stress tolls on his health.
meanings.sent2: The long hours of work tolls on her well-being.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending assignments tolls on my energy levels.
meanings.sent4: The emotional burden tolls heavily on his heart.
meanings.sent5: The relentless pressure tolls on their mental health.
